snippet: Cloud computing and other Internet services are coming to agriculture, allowing farmers to keep better track of their crops, livestock and expenses.
abstract: Randall Stross Digital Domain column observes that cloud computing and other Internet services are coming to agriculture, allowing farmers to keep better track of their crops, livestock and expenses.
lead_paragraph: Cloud computing and other Internet services are coming to agriculture, allowing farmers to keep better track of their crops, livestock and expenses.

headline.seo: Farm Software Tries to Make Its Mark - Digital Domain
headline.main: Letting the Cloud Watch Over the Farm
